etymology.description: 电(電) (diàn, "electric") + 影(影) (yǐng, "shadow" or "film") = 电影(電影) (diànyǐng, "movie"); 明(明) (míng, "bright" or "famous") + 星(星) (xīng, "star") = 明星(明星) (míngxīng, "star" or "celebrity")
etymology.interpretation: 电影(電影) (diànyǐng, "movie") literally refers to a film made with electrical technology, while 明星(明星) (míngxīng, "star") denotes someone famous and shining. A 电影明星(電影明星) is a renowned and celebrated individual in the world of cinema.
etymology.simplification: 電; 影; 明; 星

examples.chinese: 这位电影明星热爱表演(這位電影明星熱愛表演)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè wèi diànyǐng míngxīng rè'ài biǎoyǎn.

examples.chinese: 电影明星走上红毯(電影明星走上紅毯)，接受观众热烈掌声(接受觀眾熱烈掌聲)。
examples.pinyin: Diànyǐng míngxīng zǒu shàng hóng tǎn, jiēshòu guānzhòng rèliè zhǎngshēng.
examples.english: The movie star walked the red carpet and received enthusiastic applause from the audience.

examples.chinese: 许多年轻人梦想成为电影明星(許多年輕人夢想成為電影明星)。
examples.pinyin: Xǔduō niánqīngrén mèngxiǎng chéngwéi diànyǐng míngxīng.
examples.english: Many young people dream of becoming movie stars.
